string.name: about_preference_title
string.translate_description: In the about activity, the title.

string.name: about_description
string.translate_description: In the about activity, the description of the app.

resources.string: OpenTracks is a sport tracking application that completely respects your privacy.

string.name: about_url
string.translate_description: In the about activity, the URL to the source code repository.

string.name: about_version_name
string.translate_description: In the about activity, the version of the source code (i.e., Android's versionName).

string.name: about_version_code
string.translate_description: In the about activity, the version of the source code (i.e., Android's versionName).

string.name: about_history
string.translatate_description: In the about activity, the relationship with MyTracks.

resources.string: OpenTracks is a fork of Google\'s MyTracks (discontinued in 2016).

string.name: about_libraries
string.translatate_description: In the about activity, the header of the 3rd party libraries.

string.name: app_not_installed_show_on_map
string.translation_description: When 'show on map' is used and no app with this functionality is installed.

resources.string: Please install an app that supports presenting map data.

string.name: description_activity_type
string.translation_description:
Activity type description.
%1$s activity type. E.g., 'hiking'.

string.name: description_average_moving_pace_in_minute
string.translation_description:
Average moving pace description.
%1$s pace in minutes per kilometer %2$s pace in minutes per mile

string.name: description_average_moving_speed
string.translation_description:
Average moving speed description.
%1$.2f speed in kilometers per hour %2$.1f speed in miles per hour

string.name: description_average_pace_in_minute
string.translation_description:
Average pace description.
%1$s pace in minutes per kilometer %2$s pace in minutes per mile

string.name: description_average_speed
string.translation_description:
Average speed description.
%1$.2f speed in kilometers per hour %2$.1f speed in miles per hour

string.name: description_elevation_gain
string.translation_description:
Elevation gain description.
%1$d elevation in meters %2$d elevation in feet

string.name: description_fastest_pace_in_minute
string.translation_description:
Fastest pace description.
%1$s pace in minutes per kilometer %2$s pace in minutes per mile

string.name: description_max_elevation
string.translation_description:
Max elevation description.
%1$d elevation in meters %2$d elevation in feet

string.name: description_max_grade
string.translation_description:
Max grade description. %% is the escape sequence for the percent symbol.
%1$d grade in percentage

string.name: description_max_speed
string.translation_description:
Max speed description.
%1$.2f speed in kilometers per hour %2$.1f speed in miles per hour

string.name: description_min_elevation
string.translation_description:
Min elevation description.
%1$d elevation in meters %2$d elevation in feet

string.name: description_min_grade
string.translation_description:
Min grade description. %% is the escape sequence for the percent symbol.
%1$d grade in percentage

string.name: description_moving_time
string.translation_description:
Moving time description.
%1$s time. E.g., '1:08:59'.

string.name: description_recorded_time
string.translation_description:
Recorded time description.
%1$s time. E.g., '2/15/2012 1:40 PM'.

string.name: description_total_distance
string.translation_description:
Total distance description.
%1$.2f distance in kilometers %2$.1f distance in miles

string.name: description_total_time
string.translation_description:
Total time description.
%1$s time. E.g., '1:08:59'.

string.name: export_all_option
string.translation_description:
When exporting all tracks to the external storage, the option to export as a certain file format.
%1$s the file format. E.g., 'KML'. %2$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: export_external_storage_error
string.translation_description:
When exporting tracks to the external storage, the error message indicating that only some of the tracks are exported.
%1$d the number of tracks successfully exported. E.g., '1'. %1$s the number of tracks to export. E.g., '2 tracks'. %2$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: export_external_storage_option
string.translation_description:
When exporting a track to the external storage, the option to export as a certain file format.
%1$s the file format. E.g., 'KML'. %2$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: export_external_storage_progress_message
string.translation_description:
When exporting tracks to the external storage, the progress message.
%1$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: export_external_storage_success
string.translation_description:
When exporting tracks to the external storage, the success message.
%1$s the number of tracks. E.g., '2 tracks'. %2$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: files_few
string.translation_description:
The phrase for 'few' files. This is used when the language requires special treatment of 'small' numbers. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals
%1$d an integer number. The number is a small number.

string.name: files_many
string.translation_description:
The phrase for 'many' files. This is used when the language requires special treatment of 'large' numbers. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals
%1$d an integer number. The number is a large number.

string.name: files_one
string.translation_description: The phrase for 1 file. This is used when the language requires special treatment of numbers like one. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals

string.name: files_other
string.translation_description:
The phrase for 'other' files. This is used when the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity (as with all numbers in Chinese). See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals
%1$d an integer number.

string.name: files_two
string.translation_description: The phrase for 2 files. This is used when the language requires special treatment of numbers like two. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals

string.name: files_zero
string.translation_description: The phrase for 0 files. This is used when the language requires special treatment of the number 0. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals

string.name: generic_description_line
string.translation_description:
A line containing a description.
%1$s description. E.g., 'At the top'.

string.name: generic_name_line
string.translation_description:
A line containing a name.
%1$s name. E.g., 'Track 1'.

string.name: gps_location_access
string.translation_description: In Android, the location access settings to modify location settings for all applications. See Settings -> Location access.

string.name: gps_disabled
string.translation_description:
In the main view, the message on the top asking the user to enable GPS.
%1$s location settings.

resources.string: GPS not enabled. Tap here to go to %1$s. Press the back button to return.

string.name: gps_disabled_location_mode
string.translation_description:
In the main view, the message on the top asking the user to select the high-accuracy location mode.
%1$s location settings.

resources.string: Select high-accuracy location mode. Tap here to go to %1$s. Press the back button to return.

string.name: gps_disabled_my_location
string.translation_description:
When pressing the my location button, the message indicating that the current location cannot be determined.
%1$s location settings.

resources.string: Current location cannot be determined. Enable more location sources at %1$s & make sure the sky is visible. Try again later.

string.name: gps_disabled_my_location_location_mode
string.translation_description:
When pressing the my location button, the message indicating that the current location cannot be determined.
%1$s location settings.

resources.string: Current location cannot be determined. Select the high-accuracy location mode at %1$s & make sure the sky is visible. Try again later.
No GPS is found on the device

string.name: gps_wait_for_better_signal
string.translation_description: In the main view, the message on the top indicating OpenTracks is waiting for a better GPS signal.

resources.string: Waiting for a better GPS signal

string.name: gps_wait_for_signal
string.translation_description: In the main view, the message on the top indicating OpenTracks is waiting for GPS signal.

string.name: image_marker
string.translation_description: The accessibility description for a marker icon, as opposed to a track icon.

string.name: image_track
string.translation_description: The accessibility description for a track icon, as opposed to a marker icon.

string.name: import_error
string.translation_description:
When importing from the external storage, the error message indicating that only some of the files are imported.
%1$d the number of files successfully imported. E.g., '2'. %2$s the number of files in the directory. E.g., '2 files'. %3$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: import_no_directory
string.translation_description:
When importing from the external storage, the error message when the directory doesn't exist.
%1$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: import_no_file
string.translation_description:
When importing from the external storage, the message in the result dialog when there is no files to import.
%1$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

resources.string: There were no files to import. Connect your device to your computer and place the files to import in %1$s.

string.name: import_no_file_title
string.translation_description: When importing from the external storage, the title in the result dialog when there is no files to import.

string.name: import_progress_message
string.translation_description:
When importing from the external storage, the progress message.
%1$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: import_selection_option
string.translation_description:
When importing all from external storage, the option to import all the files of a certain file format.
%1$s the file format. E.g., 'KML'. %2$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: import_success
string.translation_description:
When importing from the external storage, the success message.
%1$s the number of files. E.g., '2 files'. %2$s the directory. E.g., '/kml'.

string.name: marker_add_error
string.translation_description: When adding a marker, the message indicating error due to no GPS signal.

resources.string: Unable to insert a marker. No GPS signal. Try again.
All markers for this track will be permanently deleted from the device
The marker will be permanently deleted from the device
The selected markers will be permanently deleted from the device

string.name: marker_label_end
string.translation_description:
When inserting a marker to indicate the end of a track, the marker's name. E.g., 'track_name (End)'.
%1$s track name. E.g., 'Grand Canyon trail'.

string.name: marker_label_start
string.translation_description:
When inserting a marker to indicate the start of a track, the marker's name. E.g., 'track_name (Start)'.
%1$s track name. E.g., 'Grand Canyon trail'.

string.name: marker_name_format
string.translation_description:
When adding a marker, the string format for the default name.
%1$d number. E.g., '1'.

string.name: marker_split_name_format
string.translation_description:
When adding a split marker, the string format for the default name.
%1$d number. E.g., '1'.

string.name: marker_title
string.translation_description:
The title of the marker detail page.
%1$d position. E.g., '1'. %1$d total. E.g., '5'.

string.name: marker_detail_statistics_title
string.translation_description: In the marker detail page, the title for the statistics section indicating that the data below are since the last split marker.

string.name: marker_edit_marker_type
string.translation_description: In the marker edit page, the label for the marker type, including an example.

string.name: marker_edit_marker_type_hint
string.translation_description: In the marker edit page, the hint in the marker type text field when it is empty.

string.name: menu_aggregated_statistics
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to go to the aggregated statistics page.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_delete
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to delete a track or a marker.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_delete_all
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to delete all the tracks.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_edit
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to edit a track or a marker.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_export
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to export a track.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_export_all
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to export all tracks.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_feedback
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to enter feedback.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_help
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to go to the help page.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_help_feedback
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to go to the help and feedback page.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_help_forum
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to go to the help forum.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_import_all
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to import all the tracks from the external storage.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_insert_marker
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to insert a marker.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_insert_photo
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to insert a photo.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_map
string.translation_description:
In the menu, under the map layer option, the submenu to display normal map.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_markers
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to show a list of markers for the current track.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_play
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to play a track.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_search
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to start a textual search for tracks or markers.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_select_all
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to select all the items.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_sensor_state
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to go to the sensor state page.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_settings
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to go to the settings page.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_share
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to share a track.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_show_on_map
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to show a track or a marker on the map.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_split_frequency
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to configure the split frequency, how frequent to insert a split marker.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_start_gps
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to start the GPS receiver on the device.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_stop_gps
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to stop the GPS receiver on the device.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_view_photo
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to view a photo.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: menu_voice_frequency
string.translation_description:
In the menu, to configure the voice frequency, how frequent to announce status.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: recording_service
string.translation_description:
When viewing the 'Running services' on Android, the name of the My Tracks service that is recording a track in the background.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

resources.string: OpenTracks requires permission to use GPS.

string.name: search_global_description
string.translation_description: Description of what is searched in OpenTracks, to be displayed in the global system search settings.

resources.string: No tracks or markers matched your search

string.name: search_list_marker_track_location
string.translation_description:
For a marker returned in the search result, the text field indicating the track that the marker belongs to.
%1$s track name. E.g., 'Grand Canyon trail'.

string.name: search_voice_prompt
string.translation_description: Prompt shown when the user activates voice search, asking him to speak what will be searched for.

resources.string: Speak the name of a track or marker

string.name: sensor_state_battery
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the battery level on the bike sensor. E.g., 'Battery level: 50 %'.

string.name: sensor_state_cadence
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the cadence on the bike sensor. Cadence is the number of revolutions of the crank per minute. E.g., 'Cadence: 80 rpm'.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: sensor_state_cadence_value
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the value for the 'Cadence'. Cadence is the number of revolutions of the crank per minute. E.g., 'Cadence: 80 rpm'.
%1$d a number. E.g., '80'.

string.name: sensor_state_connected
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor has connected.

string.name: sensor_state_connecting
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor is connecting.

string.name: sensor_state_disconnected
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor has disconnected.

string.name: sensor_state_heart_rate
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the heart rate from a heart rate sensor. E.g., 'Hear rate: 100 bpm'.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: sensor_state_heart_rate_value
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the value for the 'Heart rate'. E.g., 'Heart rate: 100 bpm'.
%1$d a number. E.g., '100'.

string.name: sensor_state_last_sensor_time
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the last time the sensor has sent a data. E.g., 'Last sensor time: 10:05 am'.

string.name: sensor_state_power
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the power from the bike sensor. Power is the power output of the rider. E.g., 'Power: 50 W'.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: sensor_state_power_value
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the value for the 'Power'. Power is the power output of the rider. E.g., 'Power: 50 W'.
%1$d a number. E.g., '50'.

string.name: sensor_state_sending
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor is sending data.

string.name: sensor_not_known
string.translation_description: Error message if sensor is not available in Android (e.g., pairing was removed in Bluetooth Settings).

resources.string: Sensor %1$s is not known. Please check the settings.

string.name: settings_not_while_recording
string.translation_description: In settings, the summary for an option that is not available during a track recording.

resources.string: Not available while recording a track

string.name: settings_show
string.translation_description:
In settings, the section label to show additional values.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_advanced
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the 'Advanced' options.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_chart_by_distance
string.translation_description: In the 'Chart' settings, the option to display the x axis by distance.

string.name: settings_chart_x_axis
string.translation_description:
In the 'Chart' settings, the option to change the x axis display, either by distance or by time.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_show_on_lockscreen_while_recording_title
string.translation_description: In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the 'show on lockscreen' behavior while recording.

string.name: settings_recording_show_on_lockscreen_while_recording_summary
string.translation_description: In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the 'show on lockscreen' behavior while recording.

resources.string: While recording, show statistics without unlocking the device.

string.name: settings_recording
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the recording settings.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume_track_timeout_always_summary
string.translation_description: In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Auto-resume' setting when 'Always' is selected.

resources.string: Always resume a recording after reboot

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume_track_timeout_never_summary
string.translation_description: In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Auto-resume' setting when 'Never' is selected.

resources.string: Never resume a recording after reboot

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume_track_timeout_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Auto-resume' setting when a time value is selected.
%1$s time value. E.g., '5 min'.

resources.string: Resume a recording after reboot if the last recorded location was within the last %1$s

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume_track_timeout_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the title to configure automatically resuming a recording after reboot.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_default_activity_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the title to configure the default activity type for a new track. E.g., 'hiking'.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_location_frequency_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for how frequent a location should be recorded.
%1$s distance or time. E.g., '5 m' or '1 s'.

string.name: settings_recording_max_recording_distance_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Max distance' setting.
%1$s distance value. E.g., '5 m'.

resources.string: A new segment is created if the distance between two locations is greater than %1$s

string.name: settings_recording_max_recording_distance_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the title to configure the maximum distance between 2 locations in a segment. A new segment is created if the distance between 2 locations is greater than this value.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_min_recording_distance_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the title to configure the distance between two recorded locations.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_min_recording_interval_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the title to configure the time between two recorded locations.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_min_required_accuracy_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'GPS accuracy' setting.
%1$s distance value. E.g., '10 m'.

resources.string: Location is ignored if its accuracy is less than %1$s

string.name: settings_recording_min_required_accuracy_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the title to configure the GPS accuracy.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_track_name_date_iso_8601_option
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the option in the 'Default track name' setting to use the track starting time in the ISO-8601 format as the default track name.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_track_name_date_local_option
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the option in the 'Default track name' setting to use the track starting time in the local format as the default track name.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_track_name_number_option
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the option in the 'Default track name' setting to use number as the default track name.
Character limit: ~20 (1 line)

string.name: settings_recording_track_name_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the option to configure how the default track name is named.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_reset
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup and reset' settings, the option to reset all settings to the default values.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_reset_confirm_message
string.translation_description: In the 'Backup and reset' settings, after pressing the 'Reset' option, the confirmation dialog message informing the user that all settings will be reverted.

resources.string: All settings will be reverted to the default values. This will not delete any tracks on the device.

string.name: settings_reset_confirm_title
string.translation_description: In the 'Backup and reset' settings, after pressing the 'Reset' option, the title of the confirmation dialog.

string.name: settings_reset_done
string.translation_description: In the 'Backup and reset' settings, after pressing the 'Reset' option, the confirmation dialog informing the user that all settings have been reverted to the default values.

resources.string: All settings have been reverted to the default values

string.name: settings_sensor
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the sensor settings.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_ant_reset_bike_cadence_sensor
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor' settings, under the 'ANT+' section, the option to reset an ANT+ bike cadence sensor. Note that ANT+ is a radio standard.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_ant_reset_combined_bike_sensor
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor' settings, under the 'ANT+' section, the option to reset an ANT+ combined bike cadence and speed sensor. Note that ANT+ is a radio standard.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_ant_reset_heart_rate_monitor
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor' settings, under the 'ANT+' section, the option to reset an ANT+ heart rate monitor. Note that ANT+ is a radio standard.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_ant_reset_speed_distance_monitor
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor' settings, under the 'ANT+' section, the option to reset an ANT+ stride based speed distance monitor, also known as foot pod. Note that ANT+ is a radio standard.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor' settings, the section to configure the Bluetooth settings.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_pairing
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor' settings, under the 'Bluetooth' section, the option to pair with a Bluetooth sensor.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_pairing_summary
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor' settings, under the 'Bluetooth' section, the summary for the 'Bluetooth pairing' option explaining that it will open the Android's Bluetooth settings to pair a sensor.

resources.string: Open Android\'s Bluetooth settings to pair a sensor

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_sensor
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor' settings, under the 'Bluetooth' section, the picker to choose a Bluetooth sensor.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_sensor_connecting
string.translation_description:
A message when a sensor is connecting.
%1$s sensor name. E.g., 'Polar Bluetooth'.

string.name: settings_sensor_connected
string.translation_description: A message when a sensor is connected. %1$s sensor name. E.g., 'Polar Bluetooth'.

string.name: settings_sensor_disconnected
string.translation_description:
A message when a sensor is disconnected.
%1$s sensor name. E.g., 'Polar Bluetooth'.

string.name: settings_stats_coordinate
string.translation_description:
In the 'Stats settings, the option to show latitude and longitude.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_stats_grade_elevation
string.translation_description:
In the 'Stats settings, the option to show grade and elevation. Grade is the amount of inclination to the horizontal, also known as slope or incline.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_stats_rate_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Stats' settings, the option to change the preferred rate, either speed (mi/hr) or pace (min/mi).
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: settings_stats_units_imperial
string.translation_description: In the 'Stats' settings, the option to use imperial units, with examples.

string.name: settings_stats_units_metric
string.translation_description: In the 'Stats' settings, the option to use metric units, with examples.

string.name: settings_stats_units_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Stats' settings page, the option to change the preferred units, either metric (km) or imperial (mi).
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: share_track_picker_title
string.translation_description: When sharing a track with friends, the title on the picker to ask the user to select an application.

string.name: share_track_share_file
string.translation_description: After saving a track to the external storage, the button on the result dialog to share the saved track file with friends.

string.name: share_track_share_file_body
string.translation_description:
When sharing a track file with friends, the body of the message. Note that \n is the new line character.
%1$s track description.

resources.string: I think you might be interested in this track.\n\n%1$s
I would like to share a track with you

string.name: stats_elevation
string.translation_description:
In the 'Stats' page, the elevation.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: stats_grade
string.translation_description: In the 'Stats' page, the grade. Grade is the amount of inclination to the horizontal, also known as slope or incline.

string.name: stats_pace
string.translation_description:
In the 'Stats' page, the pace like minutes per mile.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: stats_speed
string.translation_description:
In the 'Stats' page, the speed like miles per hour.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line)

string.name: track_name_format
string.translation_description:
When creating a new track, the string format to name the track.
%1$d track number. E.g., '1'.

string.name: track_record_notification
string.translation_description: When recording a track, the message on the OpenTracks notification informing the user that OpenTracks is actively recording his track.

string.name: track_markers
string.translation_description:
Title indicating a particular track's markers.
%1$s track name. E.g., 'Grand Canyon trail'.

resources.string: The track and its markers will be permanently deleted from the device.
The selected tracks and their markers will be permanently deleted from the device.

string.name: track_edit_activity_type
string.translation_description: In the page to edit a track, the label for the text field to edit the activity type, including an example.

string.name: track_edit_activity_type_hint
string.translation_description: In the page to edit a track, the hint in the 'Activity type' text field when it is empty.

string.name: track_list_empty_message
string.translation_description: When the track list is empty, the message informing the user to click on the record button to start a new recording

resources.string: Start recording your next adventure here

string.name: track_list_record_error
string.translation_description: When starting a new track recording, the error message informing the user not able to record and asking the user to try again.

resources.string: Unable to start recording. No GPS signal. Try again.

string.name: track_list_record_success
string.translation_description: When starting a new track recording, a status message indicating success.

string.name: tracks_few
string.translation_description:
The phrase for 'few' tracks. This is used when the language requires special treatment of 'small' numbers. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals
%1$d an integer number. The number is a small number.

string.name: tracks_many
string.translation_description:
The phrase for 'many' tracks. This is used when the language requires special treatment of 'large' numbers. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals
%1$d an integer number. The number is a large number.

string.name: tracks_one
string.translation_description: The phrase for 1 track. This is used when the language requires special treatment of numbers like one. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals

string.name: tracks_other
string.translation_description:
The phrase for 'other' tracks. This is used when the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity (as with all numbers in Chinese). See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals
%1$d an integer number.

string.name: tracks_two
string.translation_description: The phrase for 2 tracks. This is used when the language requires special treatment of numbers like two. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals

string.name: tracks_zero
string.translation_description: The phrase for 0 tracks. This is used when the language requires special treatment of the number 0. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals

string.name: value_float_feet
string.translation_description:
Display a float value in feet (ft).
%1$.2f a float number. E.g., '2.22'.

string.name: value_float_kilometer
string.translation_description:
Display a float value in kilometers (km).
%1$.2f a float number. E.g., '2.22'.

string.name: value_float_meter
string.translation_description:
Display a float value in meters (m).
%1$.2f a float number. E.g., '2.22'.

string.name: value_float_mile
string.translation_description:
Display a float value in miles (mi).
%1$.2f a float number. E.g., '2.22'.

string.name: value_float_mile_poor_gps
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display a float value in miles (mi), recommended when having poor GPS signal.
%1$.1f a float number. E.g., '2.2'.

string.name: value_integer_feet
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in feet (ft).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_feet_excellent_gps
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in feet (ft), recommended when having excellent GPS signal.
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_feet_recommended
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in feet (ft) and that the value is the recommended value.
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_kilobyte
string.translation_description:
Display an integer value in kilobyte (kB).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_kilometer
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in kilometers (km).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_kilometer_hour
string.translation_description:
Display an integer value in kilometers per hour (km/h).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_megabyte
string.translation_description:
Display an integer value in megabyte (MB).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_meter
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in meters (m).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_meter_excellent_gps
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in meters (m), recommended when having excellent GPS signal.
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_meter_poor_gps
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in meters (m), recommended when having poor GPS signal.
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_meter_recommended
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in meters (m) and that the value is the recommended value.
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_mile
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in miles (mi).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_mile_hour
string.translation_description:
Display an integer value in miles per hour (mi/h).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_minute
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in minutes (min).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_percent
string.translation_description:
To display a value in percent like 2 %. %% is the escape sequence for the percent symbol.
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_integer_second
string.translation_description:
In a setting picker, the string format to display an integer value in seconds (s).
%1$d an integer value. E.g., '2'.

string.name: value_smallest_recommended
string.translation_description: In a setting picker, the value to use the smallest value, also the recommended value.

string.name: voice_hours_few
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'few' hours.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a small number.

string.name: voice_hours_many
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'many' hours.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a large number.

string.name: voice_hours_other
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'other' hours, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$d an integer number.

string.name: voice_minutes_few
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'few' minutes.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a small number.

string.name: voice_minutes_many
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'many' minutes.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a large number.

string.name: voice_minutes_other
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'other' minutes, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$d an integer number.

string.name: voice_pace_per_kilometer
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'time per kilometer' like 'two hours 2 minutes per kilometer'.
%1$s time. E.g., 'two hours 2 minutes'.

string.name: voice_pace_per_mile
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'time per mile' like 'two hours 2 minutes per mile'.
%1$s time. E.g., 'two hours 2 minutes'.

string.name: voice_seconds_few
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'few' seconds.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a small number.

string.name: voice_seconds_many
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'many' seconds.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a large number.

string.name: voice_seconds_other
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'other' seconds, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$d an integer number.

string.name: voice_speed_kilometers_per_hour_few
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'few' kilometers per hour.
%1$.1f a float number. The number is a small number.

string.name: voice_speed_kilometers_per_hour_many
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'many' kilometers per hour.
%1$.1f a float number. The number is a large number.

string.name: voice_speed_kilometers_per_hour_other
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'other' kilometers per hour, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$.1f a float number.

string.name: voice_speed_miles_per_hour_few
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'few' miles per hour.
%1$.1f a float number. The number is a small number.

string.name: voice_speed_miles_per_hour_many
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'many' miles per hour.
%1$.1f a float number. The number is a large number.

string.name: voice_speed_miles_per_hour_other
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say 'other' miles per hour, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$.1f a float number.

string.name: voice_template
string.translation_description:
For the voice announcement, the template to make an announcement.
%1$s distance string. E.g., '2.2 kilometers'. %2$s time string. E.g., '20 minutes 1 second'. %3$s speed/pace string. E.g., '2.2 miles per hour' for speed and '30 minutes 1 second per kilometer' for pace.

string.name: voice_total_distance_kilometers_few
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say total distance 'few' kilometers.
%1$.2f a float number. The number is a small number.

string.name: voice_total_distance_kilometers_many
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say total distance 'many' kilometers.
%1$.2f a float number. The number is a large number.

string.name: voice_total_distance_kilometers_other
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say total distance 'other' kilometers, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$.2f a float number.

string.name: voice_total_distance_miles_few
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say total distance 'few' miles.
%1$.2f a float number. The number is a small number.

string.name: voice_total_distance_miles_many
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say total distance 'many' miles.
%1$.2f a float number. The number is a large number.

string.name: voice_total_distance_miles_other
string.translation_description:
For voice announcement, to say total distance 'other' miles, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$.2f a float number.

string.name: voice_total_distance_zero
string.translation_description: For the voice announcement, the announcement when the current track's total distance is zero.

string.name: waypoint_type_atm
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for an ATM.

string.name: waypoint_type_bank
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a bank.

string.name: waypoint_type_bar
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a bar.

string.name: waypoint_type_barbecue
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a barbecue.

string.name: waypoint_type_building
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a building.

string.name: waypoint_type_bus_stop
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a bus stop.

string.name: waypoint_type_cafe
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a cafe.

string.name: waypoint_type_campfire
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a campfire.

string.name: waypoint_type_campground
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a campground.

string.name: waypoint_type_church
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a church.

string.name: waypoint_type_coffee_house
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a coffee house.

string.name: waypoint_type_convenience_store
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a convenience store.

string.name: waypoint_type_drinking_water
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a drinking water.

string.name: waypoint_type_falling_rocks
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a falling rocks.

string.name: waypoint_type_ferry
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a ferry.

string.name: waypoint_type_fire_place
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a fire place.

string.name: waypoint_type_fire_station
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a fire station.

string.name: waypoint_type_fishing
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a fishing location.

string.name: waypoint_type_gas_station
string.translation_description: When entering a 'Marker type', in the auto-complete text box, the completion suggestion for a gas station.

string.name: waypoint_type_golf_course
